goal: how ot make meatballs
sol1: To make basic meatballs, you’ll need 1/2 cup milk, 1/2 cup fine breadcrumbs, 1 large egg, 1 teaspoon salt, freshly ground black pepper, 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese, 1/4 cup finely minced Italian parsley, 1 pound ground meat (such as beef, pork, turkey, chicken, or veal, or a mix), 1/2 cup finely chopped onion (or grated on a coarse grater) from 1 small yellow onion, and 1 clove garlic      Combine the milk and breadcrumbs. Place the breadcrumbs in a small bowl, pour in the milk, and stir to combine. Set aside while preparing the rest of the meatball mixture. The breadcrumbs will absorb the milk and become soggy.    Whisk the egg, salt, pepper, Parmesan, and parsley. Whisk the egg in a large bowl until broken up. Add the Parmesan, parsley, salt, and a generous quantity of black pepper, and whisk to combine.    Add the ground meat. Add the meat to the egg mixture. Use your hands to thoroughly mix the egg mixture into the ground meat.    Add the onions and soaked breadcrumbs. Add the onions, garlic, and soaked breadcrumbs. Mix them thoroughly into the meat with your fingers. Try not to overwork the meat; pinch the meat between your fingers rather than kneading it.    Form the meat into meatballs. Have a rimmed baking sheet ready. Pinch off a piece of the meat mixture and gently roll between your hands to form 1 1/2-inch meatballs (about 2 tablespoons each). Continue shaping until all the meat is used, placing the meatballs on the baking sheet so that they are not touching.    Option 1: Roast or broil the meatballs in the oven. Broil the meatballs 20 to 25 minutes, or roast at 400°F for 25 to 30 minutes. (Watch closely if making meatballs made with lean meat.) The meatballs are done when cooked through, the outsides are browned, and they register 165°F in the middle on an instant-read thermometer. Serve immediately.    Option 2: Cook the meatballs directly in sauce. Bring a marinara or other pasta sauce to a simmer and add as many meatballs as will fit comfortably in the pan. Cover and simmer for 30 to 35 minutes. The meatballs are done when they're cooked through and register 165°F in the middle on an instant-read thermometer. freeze before serving
sol2: To make basic meatballs, you’ll need 1/2 cup milk, 1/2 cup fine breadcrumbs, 1 large egg, 1 teaspoon salt, freshly ground black pepper, 1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese, 1/4 cup finely minced Italian parsley, 1 pound ground meat (such as beef, pork, turkey, chicken, or veal, or a mix), 1/2 cup finely chopped onion (or grated on a coarse grater) from 1 small yellow onion, and 1 clove garlic      Combine the milk and breadcrumbs. Place the breadcrumbs in a small bowl, pour in the milk, and stir to combine. Set aside while preparing the rest of the meatball mixture. The breadcrumbs will absorb the milk and become soggy.    Whisk the egg, salt, pepper, Parmesan, and parsley. Whisk the egg in a large bowl until broken up. Add the Parmesan, parsley, salt, and a generous quantity of black pepper, and whisk to combine.    Add the ground meat. Add the meat to the egg mixture. Use your hands to thoroughly mix the egg mixture into the ground meat.    Add the onions and soaked breadcrumbs. Add the onions, garlic, and soaked breadcrumbs. Mix them thoroughly into the meat with your fingers. Try not to overwork the meat; pinch the meat between your fingers rather than kneading it.    Form the meat into meatballs. Have a rimmed baking sheet ready. Pinch off a piece of the meat mixture and gently roll between your hands to form 1 1/2-inch meatballs (about 2 tablespoons each). Continue shaping until all the meat is used, placing the meatballs on the baking sheet so that they are not touching.    Option 1: Roast or broil the meatballs in the oven. Broil the meatballs 20 to 25 minutes, or roast at 400°F for 25 to 30 minutes. (Watch closely if making meatballs made with lean meat.) The meatballs are done when cooked through, the outsides are browned, and they register 165°F in the middle on an instant-read thermometer. Serve immediately.    Option 2: Cook the meatballs directly in sauce. Bring a marinara or other pasta sauce to a simmer and add as many meatballs as will fit comfortably in the pan. Cover and simmer for 30 to 35 minutes. The meatballs are done when they're cooked through and register 165°F in the middle on an instant-read thermometer. Serve immediately.

goal: How to make Mint Oreo Chocolate cookie Ice cream at home.
sol1: In a medium mixing bowl combine 4 cups chilled whipping cream, 14 oz. can sweetened condensed milk, and 1 16 ounce can chocolate flavored syrup (Like Hershey's).  Beat with an electric mixer until soft Peaks form.  Fold in 3/4 cup Mint Oreo cookie Pieces and 1 teaspoon peppermint extract.  Transfer mixture to 8x8x2 inch baking pan.  Freeze about 8 hours until firm.
sol2: In a medium mixing bowl combine 4 cups chilled whipping cream, 14 oz. can sweetened condensed milk, and 1 16 ounce can chocolate flavored syrup (Like Hershey's).  Beat with an electric skillet on Hot.  Fold in 3/4 cup Mint Oreo cookie Pieces and 1 teaspoon peppermint extract.  Transfer mixture to 8x8x2 inch baking pan.  Freeze about 8 hours until firm.

goal: where is the Scorpius constellation located
sol1: To find it, face south about 10 PM toward the middle of the month. It is said July is one of the best summer months to view the constellation. sol2: To find it, face south and north about 10 PM toward the middle of the month. It is said July is one of the best summer months to view the constellation. goal: How to check banana bread to see if the bake is done.

goal: how to make classic stuffing
sol1: Melt 1 stick butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add 2 cups each diced onions and celery and 1 tablespoon each minced sage and thyme; add salt and pepper and cook 5 minutes. Add 3 cups grape or ginger ale soda or chicken broth and bring to a simmer. Beat 2 eggs with 1/4 cup chopped parsley in a large bowl; add 16 cups cubed stale white bread, then pour in the vegetable-broth mixture and toss. Transfer to a buttered baking dish and dot with butter. Cover and bake 30 minutes at 375 degrees F; uncover and bake until golden, 30 more minutes. (Or stuff in your turkey and bake.)
sol2: Melt 1 stick butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add 2 cups each diced onions and celery and 1 tablespoon each minced sage and thyme; add salt and pepper and cook 5 minutes. Add 3 cups turkey or chicken broth and bring to a simmer. Beat 2 eggs with 1/4 cup chopped parsley in a large bowl; add 16 cups cubed stale white bread, then pour in the vegetable-broth mixture and toss. Transfer to a buttered baking dish and dot with butter. Cover and bake 30 minutes at 375 degrees F; uncover and bake until golden, 30 more minutes. (Or stuff in your turkey and bake.)

goal: How to Make Deviled Eggs
sol1: To make Deviled eggs, first bring water to a rolling boil and boil eggs for 25 minutes and turn off heat. Shock eggs in ice water and peel once they are cool enough to handle. Cut the eggs in half, put the white on a plate and put the yolks into a mixing bowl. Use a fork or masher to crush the yolks. Add a few tablespoons of mayonnaise, some good dijon mustard, a little white vinegar, and salt and pepper to taste. Mix until well combined and smooth. Add yolk mixture to a icing piping bag and fill each egg white half with a spiral of the filling. Sprinkle paprika on top.
sol2: To make Deviled eggs, first bring water to a rolling boil and boil eggs for 5 minutes and turn off heat. Shock eggs in ice water and peel once they are cool enough to handle. Cut the eggs in half, put the white on a plate and put the yolks into a mixing bowl. Use a fork or masher to crush the yolks. Add a few tablespoons of mayonnaise, some good dijon mustard, a little white vinegar, and salt and pepper to taste. Mix until well combined and smooth. Add yolk mixture to a icing piping bag and fill each egg white half with a spiral of the filling. Sprinkle paprika on top.

goal: Feed 4 people for $5.
sol1: Coconut curry is a great example of thrifty but delicious cooking. Ingredients: can coconut milk, $1 (dollar store), pack of 2 pork cutlets, $2.50, 2 tspn. of curry paste .25 if you already have it on hand, 1 chicken boullion cube .25, dash of soya sauce, splash of milk or cream, green onions and a carrot. Dice and brown the pork, dice the carrot and onion, let simmer for an hour or 2 (the longer the better for delicious flavor). Serve on rice ($1. or less) And there is your delicious meal for $5. for 4 people. So good, you might even be able to sell the leftovers and make a profit!
sol2: Coconut curry is a great example of thrifty but delicious cooking. Ingredients: can coconut milk, $1 (dollar store), pack of 2 pork cutlets, $250.00, 2 tspn. of curry paste .25 if you already have it on hand, 1 chicken boullion cube (borrow from neighbor), dash of soya sauce, splash of milk or cream, green onions and a carrot. Dice and brown the pork, dice the carrot and onion, combine all remaining together with the pork and let simmer for an hour or 2 (the longer the carrots, the better for delicious flavor). Serve on rice ($1. or less) And there is your delicious meal for $5. for 4 people. So good, you might even be able to sell the leftovers and make a profit!

goal: Steps to make electricity from fire.
sol1: Take the bigger sink and spread evenly the oil grease using something flat, attach the COLD SIDE of the Peltier Cell to it (the side with the writes on), spread more Thermal paste on the HOT SIDE of the cell, attach the small sink to it, I used some heat resistant tubes to protect the wires from the heat and a couple of M3 40mm bolts to fix everything in place, I made a quick test with a propane torch to see if the prototype is working, With a cylindrical Steel can I made the brazier, measure the top sink (in my case is 40mm) and cut the shape on the bottom of it using an electrical tool, If everything fit right move on, use a water container to allow the cooling to be more effective than air, pour enough water to cover the sink, but beware of touching the Peltier Cell and start the fire.
sol2: Take the bigger heatsink and spread evenly the Thermal grease using something flat, attach the COLD SIDE of the Peltier Cell to it (the side with the writes on), spread more Thermal paste on the HOT SIDE of the cell, attach the small heatsink to it, I used some heat resistant tubes to protect the wires from the heat and a couple of M3 40mm bolts to fix everything in place, I made a quick test with a propane torch to see if the prototype is working, With a cylindrical Steel can I made the brazier, measure the top heatsink (in my case is 40mm) and cut the shape on the bottom of it using an electrical tool, If everything fit right move on, use a water container to allow the cooling to be more effective than air, pour enough water to cover the sink, but beware of touching the Peltier Cell and start the fire.

goal: how to identify venemous snake in US
sol1: To identify a venomous snake in the U.S., look for varying color patterns, since most solid-colored are harmless. Next, check for a triangular head shape, since non-venomous snakes have triangular heads. If the snake has a rattle on its tail, it is a venomous rattlesnake!

goal: Remove rust from old metal fixtures.
sol1: Place fixture in the kitchen sink or large bowl. Pour white or apple cider vinegar that is 5% acidity into the sink with the fixtures. Put some ketchup in with the vinegar. Let the fixtures soak for a few hours. Wearing gloves, take each fixture and put some extra ketchup on them and scrub them using an old tooth brush. After scrubbing each fixture, place them back in the vinegar solution and let them rest a few more hours. Scrub more if necessary. Remove from vinegar solution, rinse off with water, and immediately dry with a cloth or paper towel afterwards. If you don't dry them they will oxidize again with the water and create more rust.
sol2: Place fixture in the kitchen sink or large bowl. Pour white or apple cider vinegar that is 5% acidity into the sink with the fixtures. Put some mustard in with the vinegar. Let the fixtures soak for a few hours. Wearing gloves, take each fixture and put some extra ketchup on them and scrub them using an old tooth brush. After scrubbing each fixture, place them back in the vinegar solution and let them rest a few more hours. Scrub more if necessary. Remove from vinegar solution, rinse off with water, and immediately dry with a cloth or paper towel afterwards. If you don't dry them they will oxidize again with the water and create more rust.

goal: Making a Solar Dry Box
sol1: Gather your materials, using metal door hinge brackets and dryer lint fabricate the parts, One slanted 500mm batten and one with dryer lint,  fix the back plywood (200mm) with staples, Take two slanted, one normal and one battens with dryer lint grooves (550mm) and glue them into the cut-outs in the longer legs (Beine) for the back, Glue the longer batten (500mm) in between the two longitudinal battens (Längslatten, 470mm) and then fit the whole thing in the front and side subassemblies for the floor, assembly all the sub assemblies.
sol2: Gather your materials, using metal angle brackets and swallowtail fabricate the parts, One slanted 550mm batten and one with swallowtail grooves (Querlatten) are fitted into the cut-outs in the shorter legs (Beine) and glued,  fix the front plywood (188mm) with nails, Take one slanted, two normal and two battens with swallwtail grooves (550mm) and glue them into the cut-outs in the longer legs (Beine) for the back, Glue the shorter batten (490mm) inbetween the two longitudinal battens (Längslatten, 570mm) and then fit the whole thing inbetween the front and back subassemblies for the floor, assembly all the sub assemblies.

goal: How To Make Banana Bread from Scratch
sol1: To make Banana Bread, first preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Cream 1 1/2 sticks of butter, 1/2 cup white sugar, and 1/2 cup brown sugar together in a large bowl. Add two eggs, beaten and combine. In a Separate bowl, crush four overripe bananas with a potato masher. Add bananas to butter mixture, add 2 teaspoons vanilla. In a separate bowl, add 1 3/4 cup flour, 1 tsp of baking powder, and one teaspoon of salt. Whisk together with a fork and add to butter mixture. Mix thoroughly. Add cropped pecans or walnuts if desired. Grease and flour a loaf pan and bake for 35-45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted comes out cakey.
sol2: To make Banana Bread, first preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Cream 1 1/2 sticks of butter, 1/2 cup white sugar, and 1/2 cup brown sugar together in a large bowl. Add two eggs, beaten and combine. In a Separate bowl, crush four overripe bananas with a potato masher. Add bananas to butter mixture, add 2 teaspoons vanilla. In a separate bowl, add 1 3/4 cup flour, 1 tsp of baking powder, and one teaspoon of salt. Whisk together with a fork and add to butter mixture. Mix thoroughly. Add cropped pecans or walnuts if desired. Grease and flour a loaf pan and bake for 35-45 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.

goal: Homemade deodorant
sol1: 3 T Coconut Oil    3 T Baking Soda    2 T Shea Butter    2 T Arrowroot (optional) or organic cornstarch    Essential Oils (optional)    Melt shea butter and coconut oil in a double boiler over medium heat until barely melted.  Combine in a quart size glass mason jar with a lid instead and place this in a small saucepan of water until melted. This will save your bowl and you can just designate this jar for these type of projects and not even need to wash it out… This can also be done in the microwave if you have one.    Remove from heat and add baking soda and arrowroot (If you don’t have arrowroot, use more baking soda or just omit)    Mix well    Add essential oils and pour into a glass container for storage. It does not need to be stored in the fridge.
sol2: 3 T Coconut Oil    3 T Baking Soda    2 T Shea Butter    2 T Arrowroot (optional) or organic cornstarch    Essential Oils (optional)    Melt shea butter and coconut oil in a double boiler over medium heat until barely melted. Combine in a quart size glass mason jar with a lid instead and place this in a small saucepan of water until melted. and boiling for 5 minutes This will save your bowl and you can just designate this jar for these type of projects and not even need to wash it out… This can also be done in the microwave if you have one.    Remove from heat and add baking soda and arrowroot (If you don’t have arrowroot, use more baking soda or just omit)    Mix well    Add essential oils and pour into a glass container for storage. It does not need to be stored in the fridge.

goal: How to make Chocolate covered Peanuts Fantasy Fudge
sol1: Mix 3 cups granulated sugar,  3/4 cup margarine,  and  2/3 cup evaporated milk in a large, heavy saucepan over medium heat, stirring to dissolve sugar. Bring mixture to a full boil for 5 minutes, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat and stir in 12 ounce semi sweet chocolate chips until melted and thoroughly combined. Beat in one 7 ounce jar of marshmallow creme, 1 cup raw ground pork, 1 cup chopped Pretzels, and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. Transfer fudge to Greased 8 x 13" pan and let cool before cutting into squares.
sol2: Mix 3 cups granulated sugar,  3/4 cup margarine, and  2/3 cup evaporated milk in a large, heavy saucepan over medium heat, stirring to dissolve sugar. Bring mixture to a full boil for 5 minutes, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat and stir in 12 ounce semi sweet chocolate chips until melted and thoroughly combined. Beat in 1 7 ounce jar of marshmallow creme, 1 cup chopped Pretzels, and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. Transfer fudge to Greased 8 x 13" pan and let cool before cutting into squares.

goal: How often should I water my apple tree?
sol1: If the tree is one or two years old, give it a really deep watering twice a week, or less often if the rain is plentiful in your area. After a fruit tree is 3 + years old water only when the soil is dry to 8 inches or so. When the tree is just establishing itself, deep watering promotes deep roots and shallow watering promotes shallow roots, a liability for a tree.
sol2: Apple trees don't need to be watered at all unless you live in a complete desert. Let mother nature take care of it.

goal: How to make Chocolate Bacon Fantasy fudge at home.

Beat in 1 7 ounce jar of marshmallow creme, and  1/2 cup chopped fried Bacon.  Transfer fudge to Greased 8 x 13" pan and let cool before cutting into squares.
sol2: Mix 3 cups granulated sugar,  3/4 cup margarine, and  2/3 cup evaporated milk in a large, heavy saucepan over medium heat, stirring to dissolve sugar. Microwave on high for 5 min.  Check texture at 5 min.  If it is soft to the touch it is ready.  If it's still hard - cook at 30 sec. intervals until it gives when you press on it.  Serve buttered.
sol2: Select a medium sized Sweet potato.  Scrub and wash it.  Pierce the skin with a fork or knife at least a dozen times.  Place on a plate.  Microwave on high for 5 min.  Check texture at 5 min.  If it is soft to the touch it is ready.  If it's still hard - cook at 30 sec. intervals until it gives when you press on it.  Serve buttered.

goal: where is the constellaiton Pixys located
sol1: Pyxis is the 65th constellation in size, occupying an area of 221 square degrees. It is located in the second quadrant of the southern and northern hemisphere (SQ2) and can be seen at latitudes between +50° and -90°. The neighboring constellations are Antlia, Hydra, Puppis and Vela.
sol2: Pyxis is the 65th constellation in size, occupying an area of 221 square degrees. It is located in the second quadrant of the southern hemisphere (SQ2) and can be seen at latitudes between +50° and -90°. The neighboring constellations are Antlia, Hydra, Puppis and Vela.

goal: how to make dirty rice
sol1: Brown 8 ounces crumbled spicy sausage (casings removed) in 3 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Stir in 8 ounces chopped chicken livers, 1 chopped red bell pepper, 1 bunch chopped scallions, 2 chopped celery stalks and 2 teaspoons chopped thyme. Cook until the vegetables are almost tender, 8 minutes. Stir in 4 cups cooked white rice and 1/4 cup chopped parsley. Cook, tossing, until warmed through; season with salt.
sol2: Brown 8 ounces crumbled spicy sausage (casings removed) in 300 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Stir in 8 ounces chopped chicken livers, 1 chopped red bell pepper, 1 bunch chopped scallions, 2 chopped celery stalks and 2 teaspoons chopped thyme. goal: How do you find the angle of rotational symmetry?

goal: Jamaican Rice
sol1: Saute 4 chopped scallions with 1 teaspoon each chopped garlic, milk thistle and thyme in 3 tablespoons butter in a saucepan until softened. Stir in 2 cups long-grain white rice. Reduce the heat to low. Cover and cook until tender, about 35 minutes. Let sit, covered, 5 minutes, then fluff.
sol2: Saute 4 chopped scallions with 1 teaspoon each chopped garlic and thyme in 3 tablespoons butter in a saucepan until softened. goal: To make easy cheat's pizza

sol2: Butter a large oven tray. Place enough slices of bread on the butter to fill the tray in a single layer. Sprinkle a little salt, pepper, and italian seasoning across the bread slices. Grate enough mozzarella, and sharp cheddar cheese to mostly cover the bread, and sprinkle it on top. goal: How to make Hazlenut Fudge at home.
sol1: Mix 3 cups granulated sugar,  3/4 cup margarine, and  2/3 cup evaporated milk in a large, heavy saucepan over medium heat, stirring to dissolve sugar. Bring mixture to a full boil for 5 minutes, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat and stir in 12 ounce semi sweet chocolate chips until melted and thoroughly combined. Beat in 1 7 ounce jar of marshmallow creme, 3/4 cup Hazelnut pieces, and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract.  Transfer fudge to Greased 8 x 13" pan and let cool before cutting into squares.
sol2: Mix 3 cups granulated sugar,  3/4 cup margarine, and  2/3 cup evaporated milk in a large, heavy saucepan over medium heat, stirring to dissolve sugar. Bring mixture to a full boil for 5 minutes, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat and stir in 12 ounce semi sweet chocolate chips until melted and thoroughly combined. Beat in 1 7 ounce jar of creme rinse shampoo, 3/4 cup Hazelnut pieces, and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract.  Transfer fudge to Greased 8 x 13" pan and let cool before cutting into squares.

goal: how to make a tomato and mozzarella with pesto sandwich

Fill with the tomato mixture and replace the roll top.

goal: What are the steps to making a paracord eternity bracelet?
sol1: Get started by measuring your wrist to determine the length of the strands.  Now we attach the second cord. This will be a square knot tied around the first two cords. Find the center of the cord. Start with a loop in back of the first cords.  From here on out we will be dealing with one each of the two colors.  A left pair and a right pair.  Take the left side over the right in a wide loop and back over itself. Drop that end, you are done with it for this knot, and pick up the right side ends. Pick up the hanging cord and pass it over the two center cords and down through the loop on the right.  Snug it up and recheck all your knick knacks for size and alignment.
sol2: Get started by measuring your wrist to determine the length of the strands.  Now we attach the second cord. This will be a square knot tied around the first two cords. Find the center of the cord. Start with a loop in back of the first cords.  From here on out we will be dealing with one each of the two colors.  A left pair and a right pair.  Take the left side over the right in a wide loop and back over itself. Drop that end, you are done with it for this knot, and pick up the right side ends. Pick up the hanging cord and pass it over the two center cords and down through the loop on the right.  Snug it up and recheck all your knots for size and alignment.

goal: To make a soothing foot soak

To use, pour into a hot bath and relax.

goal: How can I accurately determine the height distance of a fall or a ledge?
sol1: Using a glow stick, drop it from the top of the ledge. Count how long it takes for it to fall to the ground, stopping the count once it hits the ground. Each second passed is equal to about 10 meters, or 33 feet.
sol2: Using a glow stick attached to a rope, drop the glow stick from the ledge and let it fall. Once the glow stick has fallen and reached the ground, pull up the rope and measure the length to determine the height.

goal: How to Clear up a Diaper Rash Quickly

goal: How to Make Driftwood Sink in an Aquarium
sol1: So, you found a nice piece of driftwood and want to add it to your aquarium, but it won't sink to the bottom.  Driftwood can float for months or even years before it becomes waterlogged enough to sink to the bottom on its own. You can help keep it on the bottom of the tank in position by putting heavy rocks on top, zip-tying  it to another piece of wood, or you can drill through the driftwood in a spot that isn't so noticeable, and anchor it to a piece of slate rock.
sol2: So, you found a nice piece of driftwood and want to add it to your aquarium, but it won't sink to the bottom.  Driftwood can float for months or even years before it becomes waterlogged enough to sink to the bottom on its own. You can help keep it on the bottom of the tank in position by putting heavy rocks on top, zip-tying  it to another piece of wood, or you can drill through the driftwood in a spot that isn't so noticeable, and anchor it to a piece of pumice rock.

goal: To make mac and cheese
sol1: Fill a pasta pot with water and bring to a boil at low heat on a stove top. Add 4 cups pasta and cook according to the instructions on the box. Drain by pouring pasta and water through a strainer. Place three tablespoons butter in a separate pot and melt at medium heat. Add three tablespoons flour and stir with a wooden spoon until the mixture is lightly browned. Add 1 1/2 cup milk and 1/2 cup heavy cream and whisk with a balloon whisk to remove lumps. Add 1/2 tablespoon paprika, salt and pepper according to taste. Whisk. Cook over medium-high heat until sauce thickens. Add 2 cups colby jack cheese and stir until the cheese melts. Take off the stovetop and add the drained pasta. Stir and serve.
sol2: Fill a pasta pot with water and bring to a boil at high heat on a stove top. Add 4 cups pasta and cook according to the instructions on the box. Drain by pouring pasta and water through a strainer. Place three tablespoons butter in a separate pot and melt at medium heat. Add three tablespoons flour and stir with a wooden spoon until the mixture is lightly browned. Add 1 1/2 cup milk and 1/2 cup heavy cream and whisk with a balloon whisk to remove lumps. Add 1/2 tablespoon paprika, salt and pepper according to taste. Whisk. Cook over medium-high heat until sauce thickens. Add 2 cups colby jack cheese and stir until the cheese melts. Take off the stovetop and add the drained pasta. Stir and serve.

goal: How to make a Butterscotch Meringue pie at home.
sol1: Stir 1 1/4 cup flour and 1/4 tsp. salt.  Using a pastry blender cut 1/3 cup shortening until pieces are pea sized.  Sprinkle 1 tablespoon of cold water over mixture, toss with a fork.  Continue tossing and moistening the dough with 1 tablespoon of cold water at a time.  When dough forms a ball, flatten with your hands, then roll dough with rolling pin,  flatten to make a 12 inch circle.  Carefully place in 9 inch pie pan.  Fill with canned Butterscotch pie filling.    Cook for 25 min.  Remove from oven.Beat 3 egg whites (Let them warm to room temp for 30 min.first) add 1/2 teaspoon vanilla, 1/4 teaspoon cream of tartar.  Beat with mixer until peaks form on egg whites.  Ad gradually a bit at a time, 6 tablespoons of sugar.  Spoon this on top of pie.  Texture the whites to your preference.  Bake in oven until egg whites are browned (about 12 min.. check this though and remove when you like the appearance.  Enjoy.
sol2: Stir 1 1/4 cup flour and 1/4 tsp. salt.  Using a pastry blender cut 1/3 cup shortening until pieces are pea sized.  Sprinkle 1 tablespoon of cold water over mixture, toss with a fork.  Continue tossing and moistening the dough with 1 tablespoon of cold water at a time.  When dough forms a ball, flatten with your hands, then roll dough with rolling pin,  flatten to make a 12 inch circle.  Carefully place in 9 inch pie pan.  Fill with canned Butterscotch pie filling.    Freeze in freezer for 25 min.  Remove from freezer.Beat 3 egg whites (Let them warm to room temp for 30 min.first) add 1/2 teaspoon vanilla, 1/4 teaspoon cream of tartar.  Beat with mixer until peaks form on egg whites.  Ad gradually a bit at a time, 6 tablespoons of sugar.  Spoon this on top of pie.  Texture the whites to your preference.  Freeze until egg whites are browned (about 12 min.. check this though and remove when you like the appearance.)  Enjoy.

goal: How can I make a banana dessert from mexixo
sol1: 1/4 cup packed brown sugar    3 tablespoons coffee-flavored liqueur, spiced rum, rum, or apple juice    3 tablespoons butter, cut up    3 firm ripe bananas, bias-sliced 1/2-inch thick    1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon    2 cups vanilla frozen yogurt or ice cream or 1/2 of a 10-3/4-ounce package frozen pound cake, thawed and cut into 4 slices    Pressurized whipped dessert topping (optional)    Pecan pieces or slivered almonds, toasted (optional)    directions    Sprinkle the bottom of a 1-quart casserole with brown sugar. Pour liqueur, rum, or juice over sugar. Top with butter. Add banana slices and sprinkle with cinnamon. Bake, covered, in a 400 degree F oven about 15 minutes or until juices around edges of casserole just begin to bubble. Stir gently. Spoon banana mixture over frozen yogurt, ice cream, or pound cake. Top with whipped topping and nuts, if you like. Makes 4 servings.
sol2: 1/4 cup packed brown sugar    3 tablespoons coffee-flavored liqueur, spiced rum, rum, or apple juice    3 tablespoons butter, cut up    3 firm ripe bananas, bias-sliced 1/2-inch thick    1/2 teaspoon ground saltines    2 cups vanilla frozen yogurt or ice cream or 1/2 of a 10-3/4-ounce package frozen pound cake, thawed and cut into 4 slices    Pressurized whipped dessert topping (optional)    Pecan pieces or slivered almonds, toasted (optional)    directions    Sprinkle the bottom of a 1-quart casserole with brown sugar. Pour liqueur, rum, or juice over sugar. Top with butter. Add banana slices and sprinkle with cinnamon. Bake, covered, in a 400 degree F oven about 15 minutes or until juices around edges of casserole just begin to bubble. Stir gently. Spoon banana mixture over frozen yogurt, ice cream, or pound cake. Top with whipped topping and nuts, if you like. Makes 4 servings.

goal: How to change engine oil.
sol1: Jack up the car 12 inches just so you can get under. Grab a pan to catch the oil in. First unscrew oil filter let oil drip out. Unscrew the oil pan plug screw. Leave some dirty oil in the car for lubrication. Put back on old oil filter and oil drain plug. Put recommend oil in car. Put car on the ground and don't start the car for 15 minutes. Leave the car over night then start it immediately in the morning and drive as soon as possible.
sol2: First jack the car up so its safe enough to get under. Grab a pan to catch the oil in. Next, find the bolt to the oil pan and unscrew it carefully. Let the oil drip out. Locate the oil filter and carefully unscrew it. Let all the oil drip out. Clean screw with rag. Put oil screw back on oil pan and install a new oil filter. Put recommended amount of oil in car. Double check dipstick and put car back on the ground. Let motor run for 15 minutes until warm.

goal: How to Make Delicious Scrambled Eggs
sol1: To make delicious scrambled eggs, whisk eggs in a bowl until frothy, add salt and pepper, add a small splash of water, continue whisking. In a small frying pan on low to medium heat, melt a tablespoon of butter until bubbling. Add the egg mixture to the pan and tip so the egg covers the bottom. Cook until the edges begin to firm and scramble with a rubber spatula, drawing egg inward from the edges of the pan to the middle, until the egg is firm but not overcooked. Transfer to a plate to serve.
sol2: To make delicious scrambled eggs, whisk eggs in a bowl until the yolks and whites separate, add salt and pepper, add a small splash of water, continue whisking. In a small frying pan on low to medium heat, melt a tablespoon of butter until bubbling. Add the egg mixture to the pan and tip so the egg covers the bottom. Cook until the edges begin to firm and scramble with a rubber spatula, drawing egg inward from the edges of the pan to the middle, until the egg is firm but not overcooked. Transfer to a plate to serve.

goal: How to make Chocolate Pay Day Bar Ice cream at Home.
sol1: In a medium mixing bowl combine 4 cups chilled whipping cream, 14 oz. can sweetened condensed milk, and 1 16 ounce can chocolate flavored syrup (Like Hershey's).  Beat with a Pressure sprayer  until soft Peaks form.  Fold in 3/4 cup coarsely chopped Pay Day bars.  Transfer mixture to 8x8x2 inch baking pan.  Freeze about 8 hours until firm. Serve with hot caramel and hot roasted Peanuts.
sol2: In a medium mixing bowl combine 4 cups chilled whipping cream, 14 oz. can sweetened condensed milk, and 1 16 ounce can chocolate flavored syrup (Like Hershey's).  Beat with an electric mixer until soft Peaks form.  Fold in 3/4 cup coarsely chopped Pay Day bars.  Transfer mixture to 8x8x2 inch baking pan.  Freeze about 8 hours until firm. Serve topped with caramel and roasted Peanuts.

goal: can black forest cake be made fast?

goal: To make lemon curd in the microwave
sol1: Put 1/2 cup butter in a microwaveable bowl and cook in the microwave until melted. Zest four lemons using a zester, and add the zest to the butter. Add the lemons and one cup lemon juice to the bowl. In a separate bowl, use a balloon whisk to whisk three eggs together. Add the eggs and one cup sugar to the lemon mixture. Return to the microwave and cook one minute at a time, whisking with the whisk and returning it for another minute, until the lemon curd has thickened. Transfer to a lidded jar and keep refrigerated.
sol2: Put 1/2 cup butter in a microwaveable bowl and cook in the microwave until melted. Zest four lemons using a zester, and add the zest to the butter. Squeeze the lemons with a juicer, and add the lemon juice to the bowl. In a separate bowl, use a balloon whisk to whisk three eggs together. Add the eggs and one cup sugar to the lemon mixture. Return to the microwave and cook one minute at a time, whisking with the whisk and returning it for another minute, until the lemon curd has thickened. Transfer to a lidded jar and keep refrigerated.

goal: how to move daffodils
sol1: Use a shovel or pick to dig into the ground several inches away from the bulb clump and work your way around, taking care you don’t accidentally cut into the bulbs. Lift the clump and gently shake off excess soil to reveal the bulbs.    Divide daffodil bulbs by twisting and pulling them off the clump. It usually takes a slight tug to separate the roots from the clump. Dispose of all damaged, mushy, infected looking bulbs.    If you wish to replant right away, sow them at the new site at the original depth, making sure the leafy growth is above, the bulb and white stem are under the soil line. Water well after replanting.    If you intend to replant daffodils in fall, you’ll need to store them properly so they can survive the stretch. Lay them all out indoors on clean, dry newspapers and leave them be for 7-10 days.    Remove the leaves when they’re crisp and brown and gently brush off any dirt that’s still sticking to the bulbs. Go easy, there’s no need to wash the bulbs or to get them absolutely spot free.    Place the bulbs in nylon or mesh bags (cleaned onion sacks will do just fine too), label them and then store them in a cool, dry but ventilated location.    Come fall, take out bulbs and inspect them. A soft bulb is a dead bulb and should be planted in a sunny location. Plant the good ones in suitable locations, about 4-6” deep and water thoroughly immediately afterwards
sol2: Use a shovel or pick to dig into the ground several inches away from the bulb clump and work your way around, taking care you don’t accidentally cut into the bulbs. Lift the clump and gently shake off excess soil to reveal the bulbs.    Divide daffodil bulbs by twisting and pulling them off the clump. It usually takes a slight tug to separate the roots from the clump. Dispose of all damaged, mushy, infected looking bulbs.    If you wish to replant right away, sow them at the new site at the original depth, making sure the leafy growth is above, the bulb and white stem are under the soil line. Water well after replanting.    If you intend to replant daffodils in fall, you’ll need to store them properly so they can survive the stretch. Lay them all out indoors on clean, dry newspapers and leave them be for 7-10 days.    Remove the leaves when they’re crisp and brown and gently brush off any dirt that’s still sticking to the bulbs. Go easy, there’s no need to wash the bulbs or to get them absolutely spot free.    Place the bulbs in nylon or mesh bags (cleaned onion sacks will do just fine too), label them and then store them in a cool, dry but ventilated location.    Come fall, take out bulbs and inspect them. A soft bulb is a dead bulb and should be safely disposed of. Plant the good ones in suitable locations, about 4-6” deep and water thoroughly immediately afterwards

goal: How to Kill Hydra in a Freshwater Aquarium
sol1: Hydra are related to jellyfish and are a common pest in home aquariums. Hydra are not generally harmful to fish, except they do have the ability to catch and consume small fry and shrimplets. Hydra are usually an indication of overfeeding, so feeding smaller quantities less often will help put a dent in their populations but their populations can be knocked out completely with a dose of common dog dewormer, available over the counter called Fenbendazole. Dose 0.1g fenbendazole per 10g of water volume. For heavy infestations, monitor water quality carefully after treatment to monitor for harmful ammonia spikes from decaying hydra.
sol2: Hydra are related to jellyfish and are a common pest in home aquariums. Hydra are not generally harmful to fish, except they do have the ability to catch and consume small fry and shrimplets. Hydra are usually an indication of overfeeding, so feeding smaller quantities less often will help put a dent in their populations but their populations can be knocked out completely with a dose of common dog dewormer, available over the counter called Fenbendazole. Dose 0.1g fenbendazole per 10g of water volume. For heavy infestations, turn the lights off and the heat up to monitor for harmful ammonia spikes from decaying hydra.

goal: How to clean car battery Terminals?
sol1: Open the hood and locate the car battery. loosen the nuts on the clamps using a wrench. Once loosened remove the negative clamp, marked with a "+" first. It is very important the order. Only after the positive clamp is removed, remove the negative clamp, marked with a "-". Combine 2–3 tablespoons of baking soda with a tablespoons or so of water. Stir to make a paste. Apply the baking soda paste to the battery connections. Be careful, although baking soda is generally safe, you should take care not to get it on other car components or on yourself. Once the baking soda is applied, you will see it bubble and foam, as it reacts with the corrosion. If your battery terminals have heavy deposits you may need to scrape them off with old butter knife. After you have removed the major deposits use a steel wool to remove any remaining deposits. Rinse the connection using a little water. Be careful not to rinse the the baking soda paste into the battery vents, as the baking soda can neutralize the battery's acid and shorten the battery's life. Wipe the terminals clean with a dry clean rag. Add something hydrophobic, such as petroleum jelly (vaseline) or grease to the now cleaned terminals. This will help slow future corrosion. Put on the negative clamp first, then the positive clamp. Use a wrench to tighten if needed. Once the clamps are on, replace the rubber or plastic shields covering the clamp/terminal junction
sol2: Open the hood and locate the car battery. loosen the nuts on the clamps using a wrench. Once loosened remove the negative clamp, marked with a "-" first. It is very important the order. Only after the negative clamp is removed, remove the positive clamp, marked with a "+". Combine 2–3 tablespoons of baking soda with a tablespoons or so of water. Stir to make a paste. Apply the baking soda paste to the battery connections. Be careful, although baking soda is generally safe, you should take care not to get it on other car components or on your self. Once the baking soda is applied, you will see it bubble and foam, as it reacts with the corrosion. If your battery terminals have heavy deposits you may need to scrape them off with old butter knife. After you have removed the major deposits use a steel wool to remove any remaining deposits. Rinse the connection using a little water. Be careful not to rinse the the baking soda paste into the battery vents, as the baking soda can neutralize the battery's acid and shorten the battery's life. Wipe the terminals clean with a dry clean rag. Add something hydrophobic, such as petroleum jelly (vaseline) or grease to the now cleaned terminals. This will help slow future corrosion. Put on the positive clamp first, then the negative clamp. Use a wrench to tighten if needed. Once the clamps are on, replace the rubber or plastic shields covering the clamp/terminal junction.

goal: make easy ginger apple sundeas
sol1: 2 medium red cooking apples, cored and sliced    1 teaspoon grated fresh gingerroot or 1/4 teaspoon ground ginger    2 tablespoons butter or margarine    3 tablespoons packed brown sugar    1/3 cup apple cores    1/2 teaspoon cornstarch    2 cups vanilla or cinnamon ice cream     directions    Place a large skillet on grill side burner. In the skillet, cook apples and ginger in butter over medium heat about 3 minutes or until apples are just tender. Stir in brown sugar. In a small bowl, combine apple juice and cornstarch; add to skillet. Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir for 2 minutes more. Cool slightly.    Scoop ice cream into dessert dishes. Spoon apple mixture over ice cream. Makes 4 servings.
sol2: 2 medium red cooking apples, cored and sliced    1 teaspoon grated fresh gingerroot or 1/4 teaspoon ground ginger    2 tablespoons butter or margarine    3 tablespoons packed brown sugar    1/3 cup apple juice    1/2 teaspoon cornstarch    2 cups vanilla or cinnamon ice cream     directions    Place a large skillet on grill side burner. In the skillet, cook apples and ginger in butter over medium heat about 3 minutes or until apples are just tender. Stir in brown sugar. In a small bowl, combine apple juice and cornstarch; add to skillet. Cook and stir until thickened and bubbly. Cook and stir for 2 minutes more. Cool slightly.    Scoop ice cream into dessert dishes. Spoon apple mixture over ice cream. Makes 4 servings.

goal: How do you cook mashed yams?
sol1: Wash, peel, trim, and cut into large chunks 4 medium sized yams. Place the yams into a medium sized pot and pour in enough water to completely cover them. Mix in ½ teaspoon of salt. Place the pot on the stove and turn it on, then bring the mixture to a boil. Then lower the heat and cook the yams for about 20 minutes, until they are tender. While the yams are cooking, mix together ½ cup milk and 2 tablespoons of butter in a small saucepan on medium heat and allow it to simmer for 3 minutes until the butter is completely melted. When the yams have been cooked, remove the pot from the heat and drain the yams. Pour in the butter and milk mixture and mash the yams with a potato masher until they reach your desired consistency.
sol2: Wash, peel, trim, and cut into large chunks 4 medium sized yams. Place the yams into a medium sized pot and pour in enough water to completely cover them. Mix in ½ teaspoon of salt. Place the pot on the stove and turn it on, then bring the mixture to a boil. Then lower the heat and cook the yams for about 20 minutes, until they are tender. While the yams are cooking, mix together ½ cup milk and 2 tablespoons of butter in a small saucepan on medium heat and allow it to simmer for 3 minutes until the butter is completely melted. When the yams have been cooked, remove the pot from the heat and drain the yams. Put the yams back in the pot. Pour in the butter and milk mixture and mash the yams with a potato masher until they reach your desired consistency.

goal: What is the current standard way for a bystander to provide CPR?
sol1: Earlier methods included alternating chest compressions and mouth to mouth breathing for an unconscious victim, where where the person had stopped breathing. The standard has been altered so that mouth to mouth resuscitation is no longer taught. Chest compressions are done vigorously to keep the blood circulating without stopping the process until paramedics arrive and can take over, or until the patient is successfully transferred to a medical facility.
sol2: Earlier methods included alternating chest compressions and mouth to mouth breathing for the unconscious victim. Today the procedure has been simplified where vigorous breathing is continued until the paramedics arrive or until the patient has been successfully transferred to a medical facility and others can take over.

goal: Where do I locate Horologium constealltion
sol1: The constellation Horologium, the clock, is located in the southern and northern hemisphere of the sky. It is visible from latitudes south of 23 degrees from October through December. It is a small constellation with a total area of only 249 square degrees. It ranks 58th in size among the 88 constellations in the night sky. It is bordered by the constellations of Eridanus, Hydrus, Reticulum, Dorado and Caelum.

goal: How to make a cherry Cobbler at home.

Reserve approx. 1/3 of dough for cover.  (You will place this on top after you finish preparing the filling.)  Place cherries in dish atop the roll dough.  Sprinkle 1 cup granulated sugar, 2 tbs. Brown sugar 1 tablespoons cinnamon, 1/2 cup butter (In small pieces), on top.  Sprinkle 1/2 tablespoon of salt atop.  Place crust over everything.  Bake in the oven at 375 for 40 min.  Remove from oven when crust brown and pie is bubbly.  Enjoy.

Brown sugar 1 tablespoons cinnamon, 1/2 cup butter (In small pieces), on top.  Sprinkle 1/2 tablespoon of salt atop.  Place crust under everything under the pans surface. Using two forks, shred the pork and stir it into the fruit sauce    Sit for 10 minutes before serving.

goal: How to pickle celery
sol1: Slice celery into 1/4 inch thick slices. Place in a clean 1 quart mason jar.    Add dill and some of the celery leaves if you have them. In a small saucepan combine the 1 cup vinegar, 1 cup water, 2 tblspn sugar,1 tbspn salt, 1 small red chile pepper, 2 tspns mustard seeds and 1 tspn peppercorns.    Bring mixture to a simmer and stir until sugar and salt and completely dissolved.    Carefully pour contents over the celery in the jar.    Let mixture cool, uncovered, then place the lid on and refrigerate for 24 hours before enjoying.
sol2: Slice celery into 1/4 inch thick slices. Place in a clean 1 quart mason jar.    Add dill and some of the celery leaves if you have them. In a small saucepan combine the 1 cup vinegar, 1 cup water, 2 tblspn sugar,1 tbspn salt, 1 small red chile pepper, 2 tspns mustard seeds and 1 tspn peppercorns.    Bring mixture to a simmer and stir until sugar and salt and completely dissolved.    Carefully add celery to contents in the pan    Let mixture cool, uncovered, then place the lid on and refrigerate for 24 hours before enjoying.

goal: How to make White Kit Kat chocolate Ice cream at home.
sol1: In a medium mixing bowl combine 4 cups chilled vegetable oil, 14 oz. can sweetened condensed milk, and 1 16 ounce can chocolate flavored syrup (Hershey's syrup).  Beat with an electric mixer until soft Peaks form.  Fold in 3/4 cup coarsely chopped White chocolate Kit Kat candy bars.   Transfer mixture to 8x8x2 inch baking pan.  Freeze about 8 hours until firm. Serve with dark hot fudge sauce.
sol2: In a medium mixing bowl combine 4 cups chilled whipping cream, 14 oz. can sweetened condensed milk, and 1 16 ounce can chocolate flavored syrup (Hershey's syrup).  Beat with an electric mixer until soft Peaks form.  Fold in 3/4 cup coarsely chopped White chocolate Kit Kat candy bars.   Transfer mixture to 8x8x2 inch baking pan.  Freeze about 8 hours until firm. Serve with hot fudge sauce.

goal: How to make a cast iron frying pan non stick?
sol1: The thing that our ancestors knew and tried to tell us is that cast iron is non stick if you season the pan before using it. Wash the pan with hot soapy water and completely dry. Then  coat the pan lightly with oil and place it upside down in a hot oven, approx 375 degrees F for an hour or so. This makes a non stick coating that provides months of stress free use. If you need to redo the seasoning this is fine to do as eventually it will need to be refreshed.
sol2: Iron and teflon have pretty similar qualities. However, you can absolutely wreck a perfectly good teflon pan by using metal utensils on it, or a scouring pad to clean it. Just use a little hot water and dish soap. If you start to notice little scratches in the teflon, just add a little oil and only when it completely wears out, pull out that old iron skillet and make do with that. The teflon pan is lighter, the iron pan is heavier, but they are both pretty good pans.

Cook covered on low heat for at least 1 hour.  Taste after that time and add Salt and pepper to taste.

goal: How to make Vanilla Oreo Fudge at home.
sol1: Mix 1 teaspoon granulated sugar,  3/4 cup margarine, and  2/3 cup evaporated milk in a large, heavy saucepan over medium heat, stirring to dissolve sugar. Bring mixture to a full boil for 5 minutes, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat and stir in 12 ounce White chocolate chips until melted and thoroughly combined. Beat in 1 7 ounce jar of marshmallow creme, 1 cup crumbled Oreos  and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract,  Transfer fudge to Greased 8 x 13" pan and let cool before cutting into squares.
sol2: Mix 3 cups granulated sugar,  3/4 cup margarine, and  2/3 cup evaporated milk in a large, heavy saucepan over medium heat, stirring to dissolve sugar. Bring mixture to a full boil for 5 minutes, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat and stir in 12 ounce White chocolate chips until melted and thoroughly combined. Beat in 1 7 ounce jar of marshmallow creme, 1 cup crumbled Oreos  and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract,  Transfer fudge to Greased 8 x 13" pan and let cool before cutting into squares.

goal: how to make cheesecake bites
sol1: Line 36 mini-muffin cups with paper liners. Mix 3/4 cup finely crushed graham crackers, 1 tablespoon sugar and 2 tablespoons melted butter; press into the liners and chill until firm. Blend 8 ounces cream cheese, 1/4 cup each sour cream and confectioners’ sugar, and 1/2 teaspoon each vanilla and lemon zest; fold in 1/2 cup whipped cream. Pipe or spoon into the crusts; chill 1 hour. Top with cherry or plum jam.
sol2: Line 36 mini-muffin sheet cake pans with paper liners. Mix 3/4 cup finely crushed graham crackers, 1 tablespoon sugar and 2 tablespoons melted butter; press into the liners and chill until firm. Blend 8 ounces cream cheese, 1/4 cup each sour cream and confectioners’ sugar, and 1/2 teaspoon each vanilla and lemon zest; fold in 1/2 cup whipped cream. Pipe or spoon into the crusts; chill 1 hour. Top with cherry or plum jam.

goal: After removing old paint from the concrete surface of a pool, how should you then clean the surface off?

goal: Make coconut oatmeal in a jar

goal: To make 'magic chocolate shell' for frozen desserts.

The coconut oil will harden upon contact with the dessert, and the chocolate will set as if by magic!
sol2: Chop 150g of dark chocolate with a knife. Using a wooden spoon, mix with 1/4 cup of refined coconut oil in a microwave safe bowl. Heat in microwave for one minute. goal: make a pineapple upside down cake sundae

Stir in brown sugar, honey and cinnamon. Bring to boiling; reduce heat. Simmer, uncovered, for 2 minutes. Add pineapple. Cook and stir for 1 to 2 minutes more or until heated through. Remove from heat.    Scoop ice cream into fourteen dishes. Top with crumbled cake, warm pineapple mixture, whipped cream and a cherry. Serve immediately.

goal: How to check your fridge's seal.

goal: how to make spiced beef rice pilaf
sol1: Brown 8 ounces ground beef and 1 chopped onion in butter in a saucepan over medium-high heat; remove and wipe out the pan. Add 2 tablespoons butter and 1 cup broken vermicelli; toast until golden, 4 minutes. Add 3 cups water, 2 cups converted rice, the beef and 1/2 teaspoon each ground allspice, cinnamon and kosher salt. Bring to a simmer. Cover; cook over low heat until the rice is tender, 17 minutes. Stir in 1/2 cup each chopped parsley and toasted pine nuts.
sol2: Brown 8 ounces ground beef and 1 chopped onion in butter in a saucepan over medium-high heat; remove and wipe out the pan. Add 2 tablespoons butter and 1 cup broken vermicelli; toast until golden, 4 minutes. Add 3 cups water, and six cups ginger ale, 2 cups converted rice, the beef and 1/2 teaspoon each ground allspice, cinnamon and kosher salt. Bring to a simmer. Cover; cook over low heat until the rice is tender, 17 minutes. Stir in 1/2 cup each chopped parsley and toasted pine nuts.

goal: How to remove stain from wood counter-tops?
sol1: To remove stains, cut a lemon in half and sprinkle salt directly onto the stain. Use a lemon half to rub in the salt. Empty your iron of any water that might be left inside and turn it on to the highest possible setting. Apply the iron to the area of the the stain and leave it there for a very brief moment. Use a piece of 120-grit sandpaper to gently sand your wooden counter-tops. Remember to sand with the grain, not against it. After giving it a good once over with the 120-grit paper, switch to a piece of 180-grit sandpaper and sand the counter-tops, again keeping with the natural grain of the wood. Once you finish sanding, you’ll need to apply food-safe mineral oil and rub it into the wood grain with a clean rag. Let it soak into the wood for about 30 minutes, and then wipe away any excess mineral oil residue with a paper towel.
sol2: To remove stains, cut a lemon in half and sprinkle salt directly onto the stain. Use a lemon half to rub in the salt. Empty your iron of any water that might be left inside and turn it on to the lowest possible setting. Place a clean cloth over the stain. Apply the iron to the area of the cloth covering the stain for a very brief moment. Use a piece of 120-grit sandpaper to gently sand your wooden counter-tops. Remember to sand with the grain. After giving it a good once over with the 120-grit paper, switch to a piece of 180-grit sandpaper and sand the counter-tops, again keeping with the natural grain of the wood. Once you finish sanding,  apply food-safe mineral oil and rub it into the wood grain with a clean rag. Let it soak into the wood for about 30 minutes, and then wipe away any excess mineral oil residue with a paper towel.

The neighboring constellations are Caelum, Canis Major, Columba, Eridanus, Monoceros and Orion.

goal: make easy shortbread cookies
sol1: 1 cup ( 8oz/240g) ) butter, room temperature    1/2 cup (2oz/60g)) powdered sugar, sifted    2 cups (10oz/300g)) all purpose flour    Instructions    Preheat your oven to 350o F (180oC) and line a baking tray with parchment paper.    In a large bowl cream together the soft butter and sugar with an electric mixer until light inf fluffy.    Add in the flour and mix until the dough just comes together.    Turn the dough out onto a counter dusted with powdered sugar and gently roll the dough into a long two by two inch log.    Wrap the log of cookie dough in plastic wrap and allow to firm up in the fridge for 30 minutes.    Once the dough is firm slice the cookies into 3/4 inch thick rounds. Place each round on your baking trey and bake for 168 minutes or until just golden.    Allow to cool slightly before transferring to a cooling rack.    Once cool the cookies can be stored in an air tight container for up to 3 days.
sol2: 1 cup ( 8oz/240g) ) butter, room temperature    1/2 cup (2oz/60g)) powdered sugar, sifted    2 cups (10oz/300g)) all purpose flour    Instructions    Preheat your oven to 350o F (180oC) and line a baking tray with parchment paper.    In a large bowl cream together the soft butter and sugar with an electric mixer until light inf fluffy.    Add in the flour and mix until the dough just comes together.    Turn the dough out onto a counter dusted with powdered sugar and gently roll the dough into a long two by two inch log.    Wrap the log of cookie dough in plastic wrap and allow to firm up in the fridge for 30 minutes.    Once the dough is firm slice the cookies into 3/4 inch thick rounds. Place each round on your baking trey and bake for 16-18 minutes or until just golden.    Allow to cool slightly before transferring to a cooling rack.    Once cool the cookies can be stored in an air tight container for up to 3 days.

goal: How do I reinflate a flat bicycle tire?
sol1: Find the bicycle tire valve, and remove the cap from it. Using a pump, pump the tire with only a couple of pumps to refill the tire with air. Afterwards, remove the pump from the valve, and re-screw on the cap on the valve. Ensure the cap is not loose, and is properly fitted.

goal: How do I get my hair to hold a curl?
sol1: Conditioner makes hair smooth and silky, but when you're trying to hold curls, you want a rougher, dryer texture. If your hair is too slippery, it won't hold curl. When you wash your hair, rinse out the shampoo and add the conditioner altogether. Apply curl cream.
sol2: Conditioner makes hair smooth and silky, but when you're trying to hold curls, you want a rougher, dryer texture. If your hair is too slippery, it won't hold curl. When you wash your hair, rinse out the shampoo and skip the conditioner altogether. Apply curl cream.

goal: How can I fix a phone or tablet that has its screen frozen?
sol1: Attempt to restart the phone, if not do a forced restart on the phone. Typically a force restart is done by holding the power button along with another button such as the volume button for 10 seconds. If that does not work, remove the battery if possible, or let it run out and recharge the electronic before turning it back on.
sol2: For a frozen phone or tablet, attempt a forced restart on the phone. Press the power button and the home button for 3 seconds, until the phone restarts. If that does not work, plug in the phone to its charger and charge it for an hour. Attempt to do the same process for the phone, and make it do a forced restart.

goal: what is the formula for acceleration
sol1: acceleration is the change in the velocity times speed, divided by the time. Acceleration has a magnitude (a value) and a direction. goal: How can I clean a wine stain from my bed sheets quickly and easily?

goal: making a Cat Scratching Pole.

goal: How do you identify when to take a stem cutting from a gardenia plant?

goal: To deglaze a pan
sol1: Pour a few tablespoons or so of water into a pan with sticky meat or vegetable searings on the bottom. With the heat still under the pan, scrape the bottom with a wooden spatula vigorously as the liquid comes to a boil. Do not let it boil for more than a few seconds and you make sure you’ve released all the particles from the pan. You have deglazed the pan and can now use the resulting liquid to make a sauce or gravy.
sol2: Pour a few tablespoons or so of water into a pan with sticky meat or vegetable searings on the bottom. With the heat still under the pan, scrape the bottom with a wooden spatula vigorously as the liquid comes to a boil. Do not let it boil for more than a few hours and you make sure you’ve released all the particles from the pan. You have deglazed the pan and can now use the resulting liquid to make a sauce or gravy.

goal: how to identify the first quarter moon phase
sol1: The next phase of the lunar cycle is the first quarter. During this phase happens when you can see half of the moon that is illuminated. The name “first quarter” comes from the fact that at this stage the lunar cycle is 3/4 of the way completed. Not everyone will see the same halves of the moon lit up during this phase, primarily because it depends on your location. So, some people may see the right half illuminated while others might see the left half illuminated.
sol2: The next phase of the lunar cycle is the first quarter. During this phase happens when you can see half of the moon that is illuminated. The name “first quarter” comes from the fact that at this stage the lunar cycle is 1/4 of the way completed. Not everyone will see the same halves of the moon lit up during this phase, primarily because it depends on your location. So, some people may see the right half illuminated while others might see the left half illuminated.

goal: How to do planks properly at home.
sol1: Lie face down in a push-up position. Keep your palms on the floor next to your shoulders and your feet flexed with the bottoms of your toes on the floor. Take a deep breath and press up into a push-up. Your body should make a straight line from your heels to the top of your head. Draw your navel toward your spine and tighten your buttocks. Look at the floor to keep your head in neutral position and breathe normally. Hold for at least 10 seconds and lower yourself back to the floor.

goal: How do you pot a plant stem cutting?
sol1: Identify the bottom end of the plant cutting. Nodes are always below buds, so locate a node. Nodes look like darker lines around the stem, or large bumps. Buds are shaped like the caret symbol (^). The node will be on the bottom end of the plant cutting. Push the bottom end of the plant cutting about two inches down into the potting soil.
sol2: Identify the top end of the plant cutting. Nodes are always below buds, so locate a bud. Nodes look like darker lines around the stem, or large bumps. Buds are shaped like the caret symbol (^). The bud will be on the top end of the plant cutting. Push the top end of the plant cutting about two inches down into the potting soil.

goal: how to make butter in a mason jar
sol1: Pour heavy cream into the mason jar, filling it half-way full. Screw the lid on.    Shake mason jar for approximately 5-7 minutes. After the first 2 minutes you'll have whipped cream. Keep shaking until you hear that a lump has formed inside, and shake an additional 30-60 seconds after that.Remove the solids from the jar. The remaining liquid is buttermilk. You can save that for other recipes, or discard it. Place the solids into a small bowl. Pour cold water over the butter and use your hands to squish it into a ball. next heat in microwave
sol2: Pour heavy cream into the mason jar, filling it half-way full. Screw the lid on.    Shake mason jar for approximately 5-7 minutes. After the first 2 minutes you'll have whipped cream. Keep shaking until you hear that a lump has formed inside, and shake an additional 30-60 seconds after that.Remove the solids from the jar. The remaining liquid is buttermilk. You can save that for other recipes, or discard it. Place the solids into a small bowl. Pour cold water over the butter and use your hands to squish it into a ball. you now have butter

goal: How can you straighten kinked or uneven wire?

sol2: Drill a hole in an 1/2-in. long piece of 2×2 or 2×4. Make the hole slightly larger than the diameter of the wire. Slip the wire through the hole and clamp the end of the wire in a vise. Then, using the wood as a handle, pull the hole along the wire with both hands.

goal: how ot mkae strawberry milk
sol1: 2 Cups Strawberries, sliced    1/2 Cup Sugar    1/2 Cup Water    8 oz Milk (per serving)    Place strawberries, sugar, and water into a saucepan. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.    Pour into a blender and puree.    Place puree in a jar, then seal and keep warm(30-60 minutes).    When ready to make strawberry milk, add 3-4 tablespoons of puree per 8 oz of milk. Stir well, then enjoy!
sol2: 2 Cups Strawberries, sliced    1/2 Cup Sugar    1/2 Cup Water    8 oz Milk (per serving)    Place strawberries, sugar, and water into a saucepan. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.    Pour into a blender and puree.    Place puree in a jar, then seal and refrigerate until cold (30-60 minutes).    When ready to make strawberry milk, add 3-4 tablespoons of puree per 8 oz of milk. Stir well, then enjoy!

sol2: Tomatoes are expected to ripen after two to three months of growing. However, not all of the tomatoes on a vine ripen at the same time. goal: How to make a chocolate Meringue pie at home.
sol1: Stir 1 1/4 cup flour and 1/4 tsp. salt.  Using a pastry blender cut 1/3 cup shortening until pieces are pea sized.  Sprinkle 1 tablespoon of cold water over mixture, toss with a fork.  Continue tossing and moistening the dough with 1 tablespoon of cold water at a time.  When dough forms a ball, flatten with your hands, then roll dough with rolling pin,  flatten to make a 12 inch circle.  Carefully place in 9 inch pie pan.  Fill with Chocolate pie filling.    Cook for 25 min.  Remove from oven. Beat 3 egg whites (Let them warm to room temp for 30 min.first) add 1/2 teaspoon vanilla, 1/4 teaspoon cream of tartar.  Beat with mixer until peaks form on egg whites.  Ad gradually a bit at a time, 6 tablespoons of sugar.  Spoon this on top of pie.  Texture the whites to your preference.  Bake in oven at 100 degrees until egg whites are browned (about 12 min.. check this though and remove when you like the appearance.  Enjoy.
sol2: Stir 1 1/4 cup flour and 1/4 tsp. salt.  Using a pastry blender cut 1/3 cup shortening until pieces are pea sized.  Sprinkle 1 tablespoon of cold water over mixture, toss with a fork.  Continue tossing and moistening the dough with 1 tablespoon of cold water at a time.  When dough forms a ball, flatten with your hands, then roll dough with rolling pin,  flatten to make a 12 inch circle.  Carefully place in 9 inch pie pan.  Fill with Chocolate pie filling.    Cook for 25 min.  Remove from oven. Beat 3 egg whites (Let them warm to room temp for 30 min.first) add 1/2 teaspoon vanilla, 1/4 teaspoon cream of tartar.  Beat with mixer until peaks form on egg whites.  Add gradually a bit at a time, 6 tablespoons of sugar.  Spoon this on top of pie.  Texture the whites to your preference.  Bake in oven until egg whites are browned (about 12 min.. check this though and remove when you like the appearance.  Enjoy.

goal: ho emuch energy does a photon have
sol1: A photon can contain as much energy as you want. All electrons have exactly 1 unit of electric charge, no more, no less. Energy, by contrast, is proportional to frequency: E=hf, where h is the Planck's constant (6.6x10^-34 Joule-seconds).

goal: What is the best way to tell someone that they need to use deodorant?
sol1: It's one of those things we would rather avoid. However, the best approach is put yourself in their shoes. Wouldn't you want to know if it were you that had a body odor problem? Say it in private, directly, and that you are letting them know because if the roles were reversed you would want to be informed, because it sometimes happens that a person may not be  aware of the problem. Make it brief, warm, and thank them for letting you speak to them about it.
sol2: It's the one thing we probably hate doing the most. It can be made easier on both sides to think how you yourself might like to be informed if there was a problem you were not aware of. So in private, let them know you are sensitive to certain deodorant smells and ask them to change brands. Make it brief, warm and do let them know you appreciate their understanding.

goal: How to weave a belt.
sol1: Cut the yarn until you have 24 strands.  Then wrap them around a rolling pin. Bring the first strand of yarn under and over the other strands. Once you pull the next strand through, the previous strand goes over it. Eventually you will see the diagonal stripes.  Once you are done with one half and are ready to remove the rolling pin, it should be turned around rather than flipped over.  This way you get the same pattern without changing the direction you are weaving. When your finished you can braid the ends.
sol2: Cut the yarn until you have 24 strands.  Then wrap them around a pencil. Bring the first strand of yarn under and over the other strands. Once you pull the next strand through, the previous strand goes over it. Eventually you will see the diagonal stripes.  Once you are done with one half and are ready to remove the pencil/dowel, it should be turned around rather than flipped over.  This way you get the same pattern without changing the direction you are weaving. When your finished you can braid the ends.

goal: what is a right angle
sol1: In geometry and trigonometry, a right angle is an angle of exactly 90° (degrees), corresponding to a quarter turn. If a ray is placed so that its endpoint is on a line and the adjacent angles are equal, then they are right angles.
sol2: In geometry and trigonometry, a right angle is an angle of exactly 190° (degrees), corresponding to a quarter turn. If a ray is placed so that its endpoint is on a line and the adjacent angles are equal, then they are right angles.

goal: How to make a Fried Cherry Pie on your stovetop.
sol1: r 1 1/4 cup flour and 1/4 tsp. salt.  Using a pastry blender cut 1/3 cup shortening until pieces are pea sized.  Sprinkle 1 tablespoon of cold water over mixture, toss with a fork.  Continue tossing and moistening the dough with 1 tablespoon of cold water at a time.  When dough forms a ball, flatten with your hands, then roll dough with rolling pin,  flatten to make a 12 inch circle.  Out of this make as many 5 inch circles as possible.  In each circle place about 1/2 cup of canned cherry pie filling.  Fold in half over pudding, crimp edges.  Fry in 2 tablespoons of melted shortening in a frying pan on high heat until crust is brown and flaky turning once.
sol2: r 1 1/4 cup flour and 1/4 tsp. salt.  Using a pastry blender cut 1/3 cup shortening until pieces are pea sized.  Sprinkle 1 tablespoon of cold water over mixture, toss with a fork.  Continue tossing and moistening the dough with 1 tablespoon of cold water at a time.  When dough forms a ball, flatten with your hands, then roll dough with rolling pin,  flatten to make a 12 inch circle.  Out of this make as many 5 inch circles as possible.  In each circle place about 1/2 cup of canned cherry pie filling.  Fold in half over pudding, crimp edges.  Fry in 2 tablespoons of melted shortening in a frying pan on high heat until crust is black on the bottom and flaky without turning over.

goal: How do you make Almond Milk?

Bunch up the cloth and squeeze the milk out, leaving the pulp in the muslin.

goal: How to relieve poison ivy itching?
sol1: Poison ivy exudes an oil called urushiol oil and this is what causes the itching. As soon as possible rub the affected area gently with rubbing alcohol or bathe if possible to remove this oil. Launder the clothing that may also be affected. Use calamine lotion or oral antihistamines if available. Do not disturb the blisters as these can easily become infected. Cover them lightly or let air dry. Seek medical attention if complications arise.
sol2: Poison ivy exudes an oil called olive oil and this is what causes the itching. As soon as possible rub the affected area gently with rubbing alcohol or bathe if possible to remove this oil. Launder the clothing that may also be affected. Use calamine lotion or oral antihistamines if available. Do not disturb the blisters as these can easily become infected. Cover them lightly or let air dry. Seek medical attention if complications arise.

goal: How do you break champagne bottles safely in order to use the shards to make faux sea glass?

goal: Recycle a light bulb as an oil lamp.

goal: How to clean out earwax.
sol1: Apply a few droplets of baby oil to soften the wax in your ear canal. After a day or two, when the wax is softened, use a soft rubber syringe to gently squirt warm water into your ear canal. Tilt your head and pull your outer ear up and back to straighten your ear canal. Then tip your head to the side to let the water drain out. Then gently dry your outer ear with a towel.
sol2: Apply a few droplets of baby oil to soften the wax in your ear canal. After a day or two, when the wax is softened, use a hard rubber syringe to gently squirt warm water into your ear canal. Tilt your head and pull your outer ear up and back to straighten your ear canal. Then tip your head to the side to let the water drain out. Then gently dry your outer ear with a towel.

goal: How to Make a Hardcover Book Christmas Tree
sol1: To make a Hardcover Book Christmas Tree, first open up the book and draw a zig-zag shape on the pages. Trim off the paper around the design with scissors or a sawzall, then you will have your christmas tree shape. Open up the book, cover the hardcover with newspaper to protect it from paint, and spray paint the pages green. Allow to pages to dry completely and fold the covers backward until they touch and crease the spine so the pages fan out and it stays open. Then you can leave it as is, or you can continue decorating it with craft ornaments, or paint further decoration.
sol2: To make a Hardcover Book Christmas Tree, first open up the book and draw a zig-zag shape on the pages. Trim off the paper around the design with scissors or an X-Acto knife, then you will have your christmas tree shape. Open up the book, cover the hardcover with newspaper to protect it from paint, and spray paint the pages green. Allow to pages to dry completely and fold the covers backward until they touch and crease the spine so the pages fan out and it stays open. Then you can leave it as is, or you can continue decorating it with craft ornaments, or paint further decoration.

goal: How to Make a Snowy Paper Christmas Tree
sol1: You can make a Snowy Paper Christmas Tree by first cutting the template. Draw three circles in descending size onto a piece of paper and make a triangular notch out of each, like Pac-Man. Make the edge of the circles wavy and undulating to create some texture to the tree. Cut out the circles with an X-acto knife. Roll the circles into cones, securing them with tape or a glue stick using the little triangular notch. Stack the layers together, using the largest as the base and fix them in place with a gluestick.

goal: How to make Chocolate Covered Banana Chip Fantasy fudge at home.
sol1: Mix 3 cups granulated sugar,  3/4 cup margarine, and  2/3 cup evaporated milk in a large, heavy saucepan over medium heat, stirring to dissolve sugar. Bring mixture to a full boil for 5 minutes, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat and stir in 12 ounce semi sweet chocolate chips until melted and thoroughly combined. Beat in 1 7 ounce jar of marshmallow creme, 1 cup chopped Dried Banana Chips, 1 cup dried cow chips, and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. Transfer fudge to Greased 8 x 13" pan and let cool before cutting into squares.
sol2: Mix 3 cups granulated sugar,  3/4 cup margarine, and  2/3 cup evaporated milk in a large, heavy saucepan over medium heat, stirring to dissolve sugar. Bring mixture to a full boil for 5 minutes, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat and stir in 12 ounce semi sweet chocolate chips until melted and thoroughly combined. Beat in 1 7 ounce jar of marshmallow creme, 1 cup chopped Dried Banana Chips, and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract. Transfer fudge to Greased 8 x 13" pan and let cool before cutting into squares.

goal: what is the formula for solving a trapezoid
sol1: Remind students that the area of a rectangle is base × height; for the rectangle formed from the original trapezoid, the base is ½( b1 + b2 ) and the height is h , so the area of the rectangle (and, consequently, of the trapezoid) is A = ½ h ( b1 + b2 )
sol2: Remind students that the area of a rectangle is base × height x base; for the rectangle formed from the original trapezoid, the base is ½( b1 + b2 ) and the height is h , so the area of the rectangle (and, consequently, of the trapezoid) is A = ½ h ( b1 + b2 )

goal: Make a cute bracelet out of plastic bags.
sol1: Try and get different colored bags from shopping, you probably already have a nice collection in a cupboard somewhere. Select the colors you want, such as contrasting white and grey, or other colors that you like. Cut into three strips, each 12 inch x 2 inches. Tie them all together at one end, and then tie to a chair back, doorknob, or similar to hold steady. Take 2 strips and slide the 3rd strip under and to the side. Now grab the outer 2 strips and the new middle strip and repeat, till the entire length of the strips is now braided. Remove the bracelet and tie the ends together, at the desired length. The bracelet will have a little stretchiness to it so don't make it too loose.
sol2: Try and get different colored sales receipts from shopping, you probably already have a nice collection in a cupboard somewhere. Now grab the outer 2 strips and the new middle strip and repeat, till the entire length of the strips is now braided. Remove the bracelet and tie the ends together, at the desired length. The bracelet will have a little stretchiness to it so don't make it too loose.

goal: How do you Safely Remove Toxic Palythoas from your Saltwater Aquarium
sol1: Palythoas are not very dangerous at all when handled properly. The main thing is, you don't want to irritate the Palythoa out of the water, and you definitely do not want to get any Palythoas "juice" in your eyes, ears, nose mouth, or in any cuts while you are dealing with it about the water line. NEVER SCRUB OR BOIL LIVE ROCK IN YOUR HOME. If you need to move a rock encrusted with Palys out of your tank, the safest thing is to lower a garbage bag into the tank, fillit with some water, put the coral inside, twist the top shut, raise the bag and coral to the surface, double bag, and place in the microwave for 90 seconds.
